metrics.name: Average Reply Latency (minutes)
metrics.description: Mean minutes from client email to first startup reply within each thread.

metrics.name: Follow-up Rate
metrics.description: Percent of threads where the startup sends at least one follow-up after no client response for 48 hours.

metrics.name: Thread Resolution Rate
metrics.description: Percent of threads reaching a clear outcome stage.

guidance.high: You respond quickly and keep threads moving. Systematize follow-ups and add a no-response sequence on day 2 and day 5.
guidance.medium: Response times and follow-ups are inconsistent. Add SLA targets and automate reminders.
guidance.low: Threads stall and replies are slow. Create a reply-time SLA and a 3-step follow-up cadence.

metrics.name: Stage Ratio Demoâ†’Pricing
metrics.description: Ratio of demo_followup to pricing_discussion threads.

guidance.high: Momentum is building. Add deadline-driven offers to accelerate commits.
guidance.medium: Interest without conversion. Tighten qualification and propose next steps during demos.
guidance.low: Top-of-funnel not converting. Rework pitch and add proof points aligned to ICP.

metrics.name: Sentiment Balance
metrics.description: Keyword heuristic comparing positive to negative cues.

metrics.name: Next-Step Clarity
metrics.description: Presence of explicit next steps or scheduled actions.

guidance.high: Tone and clarity are solid. Keep scripting next steps into every message.
guidance.medium: Mixed signals. Standardize closing lines with a concrete CTA and time window.
guidance.low: Unclear and negative tone. Rewrite templates to ask one clear question per email.

metrics.name: Meetings per Week
metrics.description: Count of meetings in the measured week.

metrics.name: Customer-facing Ratio
metrics.description: Share of customer-facing events vs total.

guidance.high: Cadence supports learning. Protect customer-facing time on the calendar.
guidance.medium: Some activity. Anchor two customer sessions per week minimum.
guidance.low: Too few meetings. Block recurring discovery and demo slots.

metrics.name: Decision-to-Chatter Ratio
metrics.description: Share of messages that record decisions or assignments.

metrics.name: Owner Assignment Presence
metrics.description: Presence of explicit owners and deadlines.

guidance.high: Tight coordination. Keep DRIs and due dates in each thread.
guidance.medium: Some ownership but lacks deadlines. Add a simple template for tasks.
guidance.low: Ambiguous ownership. Enforce DRI and due date on every action.

metrics.name: Fit Evidence Share
metrics.description: Presence of phrases that indicate clear ICP fit and repeatable use case.

guidance.high: ICP is clear. Double down with tailored proof points.
guidance.medium: Partial fit. Narrow persona and tighten offer.
guidance.low: Weak fit. Re-segment and rewrite ICP hypothesis.

metrics.name: Timestamp Completeness
metrics.description: Percent of records with valid ISO timestamps.

metrics.name: Thread Integrity
metrics.description: Percent of threads with >= 2 messages and consistent subject.

guidance.high: Clean data. Maintain structure and naming conventions.
guidance.medium: Some gaps. Add checks for timestamps and subject lines.
guidance.low: Messy records. Standardize logging and enforce minimal fields.

metrics.name: Compliance Mentions
metrics.description: Detection of compliance requirements and mitigation steps.

metrics.name: Integration Planning
metrics.description: References to integration readiness and sequencing.

guidance.high: Risks are identified and managed. Publish a one-pager for buyers.
guidance.medium: Partial coverage. Document policies and integration roadmap.
guidance.low: Gaps in compliance or integrations. Address one critical item first.

Strong: Scale what is working; add price testing and referenceable case studies.
Lock SLAs and publish a buyer-readiness checklist.
Automate follow-ups and schedule weekly customer councils.
Moderate: Choose one riskiest assumption to test in 7 days.
Double interview cadence and tighten ICP filters.
Rewrite CTAs with a single next step and a deadline.
Needs Improvement: Refactor ICP and problem statement in customer words.
Run three small experiments in two weeks with pass/fail criteria.
Institute reply-time SLAs and a 3-touch follow-up sequence.

experiments_generator.rule: Select the two lowest-scoring categories and output three experiments that directly target their weakest metrics. Each experiment includes hypothesis, setup, success_metric, and timebox_days.
